page.title: 01Lower Kentmere - General
page.content: The survey area is undulating upland, split north to south by the valley of the river Kent. The highest parts are to be found in the north west (472m.) and south east (419m.) corners, but generally, the land is rising towards the north and the high fells of central Lakeland. Towards the south, the area gives way to the broad valley followed partly by the lower Kent and routes between Windermere and Kendal, and then to the irregular landscape which leads to Morecambe Bay. The survey area is sparsely settled, Kentmere village lying immediately to the north of it. Farming is the main activity but the factory of British Industrial Sand is of interest. A quiet valley such as this does not escape tourists, the valley floor road enabling people to reach well in to the hills before starting a walk.
